headline: Creamy Mushroom Soup
description: This fresh and creamy soup is easy to make, and filled with hearty chopped mushrooms.
name: Creamy Mushroom Soup

recipeInstructions.text: Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Saute the shiitake mushrooms, portobello mushrooms, and shallots for about 5 minutes, or until soft. Mix in the flour until smooth. Gradually stir in the chicken broth. Cook, stirring, 5 minutes, or until thick and bubbly.
Stir in the half-and-half, season with salt and pepper, and sprinkle with cinnamon. Heat through, but do not boil.

review.reviewBody: Used twice as many mushrooms. White and baby bello. Heavy whipping cream and half and half. Ran it through the blender when done. A little salt and pepper, hard crusted bread with butter and 2 thumbs up.l

i added —> 2cloves of garlic, 1/2 cup frozen white corn, 1 cup of spinach, 1/2 cup jimmy dean maple sausage (cooked)all of which i sautéed with the mushrooms. i had to add 1/4 cup more butter. i also substituted with lactose free half and half. i was initially hesitant but did use cinnamon and it was great! also! i love spice so topped mine with a little cayenne pepper!! so yummy!

This is the best home made mushroom soup recipe I’ve ever used! The only changes I made was that I didn’t blend it thoroughly. I prefer some of taste and see some of the larger mushrooms. Also I only used 1/2 butter and substituted olive oil for the other half. No cinnamon. It was excellent!
Delicious and so easy. I used 1 shallot and used a food processor for the shallot and mushrooms (separately). I used 1/2 cup heavy cream and 1/2 cup almond milk. I used nutmeg instead of cinnamon.
It is really good, but it is thin. I used Portabello mushrooms and white mushrooms and it turned out well. I also added some garlic powder and thyme.
I didn't have the Shitake or portabello, or Cinnamon. Just used the regular store bought mushrooms. it was very good, I'm sure next time I make it with the other Mushrooms it will be even better.

Quick and delicious (especially with a food processor)! I chopped all my mushrooms very small in advance and didn’t need to blend it after cooking at all. I’m ashamed to say I was too cowardly to add the cinnamon, but it turned out amazing anyway!
Tastes great but next time I will use a little more flour to thicken it more. The mushrooms added more liquid.
I loved this recipe!!! I used beef broth and lots of garlic powder and pepper and a little onion powder. So delicious with rice!!

Excellent....I changed few ingredients. Used a sweet and green onion along with heavy whipping cream....At the end I stirred in fresh chopped chives and a dash of Marsala wine. Very easy and good enough for a luncheon or dinner party.
Delicious, very creamy. Good umami and very satisfying!

I made this in the past, and again last night. When I asked my guests if they’d like a second helping the response was “do you have some I can take home?”. I’d say it was a success! I do love this soup, as it’s quick, easy, and delicious. Definitely in my stable for future meals. I did add cinnamon to it. Next time will try nutmeg. A definite keeper.
Very good. Added it to Favorites.

Excellent mushroom flavor, thick and creamy! I did use regular mushrooms in place of the shitake mushrooms. And I replaced the half and half with heavy cream. Quick and easy recipe - makes two good servings. I'll be making this again!
SO easy and SO delicious. I tried with and without cinnamon and for me I prefer without. I felt the cinnamon took away from the salty creamy taste. This will be a weekly make for us.

Added 1 clove of chopped garlic, increased the butter by 1 additional tablespoon and totally ignored the cinnamon. 
It. Was. Delicious!!!
I've made it twice.

Absolutely loved it! It’s best to buy the mushrooms that are already clean and sliced. This is the second time I made this wonderful recipe. I’ll never use Campbell’s cream of mushroom soup again sorry Campbells. This is so easy and fast to make if you have the clean, sliced mushrooms, it’s great.
Super delish

Wonderful soup! I added a carrot, garlic and a chopped potato, and used some yellow onion and beef broth because that's what i had. I doubled the recipe. No cinnamon. My man can't get enough!
This will be requested often now...!

I sautéed the mushrooms, onions and garlic in the butter, then continued to follow the recipe. I wished in the flour at the end and added additional pepper and wine. Delicious. Great recipe to work with.
Great recipe and easy to make. Not sure about the cinnamon, but you can always add that by the person, and to taste.
Very good and easy. The modifications I made were: used beef broth instead of chicken, added fresh minced garlic, a little bit of soy sauce and no cinnamon!

I don't understand what all the fuss is about this recipe! This didn't even have a mushroom taste to it! Why would you want a mushroom soup without a mushroom taste? Neither myself nor my husband liked this and I ended up draining the liquid and saving the mushrooms to use in another dish tomorrow. Utterly unimpressed!
I had an abundance of dried shiitake mushrooms from a Japanese dish I made, and they were perfect for this soup. I also used low sodium chicken broth. Turned out great!!

We had a huge package of white mushrooms and needed to use them asap so I was looking for something. This recipe popped up so we tried it. The only thing I changed in the recipe was we had some left over chicken breast so we shredded it and added it. Sooo delicious! Not sure we will ever eat canned mushroom soup again lol
This soup is Fabulous!! So easy and delicious. Thank you for the recipe, it will now be a staple in my home.
I will certainly make it again.
Made with fresh (as in picked that morning) blue oyster mushrooms with a bit of portobello. Flour roux in clarified butter. Thyme with a little lemon. Finished with a touch of sherry.
only modifications I made to this recipe was no cinnamon and a spoonful of minced garlic. Also used almond flour due to keto diet restrictions. Absolutely delicious.
Added celery

Delicious! Changed two things: did not puree at all , I wanted the `chunks` and used beef broth instead of chicken. Next time I will use chicken stock just so I can compare.
Didn't use cinnamon, it didn't appeal to me
Mmm, delicious! I had to use what I had, which was button mushrooms, and ham stock (out of home made chicken stock). No shallots, used green onions. I also added some sherry. Turned out great!

Changes:
Added the flour to the chicken stock before adding to the mushrooms and shallots to keep it from being lumpy - found it hard to blend otherwise.
Added celery.
Added red chili flakes for a bit of heat
I will definitely make it again.
It was good. Kinda plain but it’s cream of mushroom soup....
This is a great soup. I also used beef broth and nutmeg but followed the test of the recipe.
Fabulous!! It’s so simple, I couldn’t believe how good it was with so few ingredients
Not a lot of flavor.. I ‘d add more mushrooms maybe some garlic ? will try again .

This recipe when followed as written was perfect. Slowly adding the liquid and stirring as you’re adding it allowed it to thicken just right. It totally brought be back to when I was a kid and my dad would make a soup similar to this. So fast and easy. I will definitely be making this again and again.

Delicious! Sooo much better than the canned stuff. I used button mushrooms because that's all I had on hand. Used an immersion blender to smooth out and chop mushrooms up a bit Finished with heavy cream instead of 1/2 and 1/2. Substituted fresh grated nutmeg instead on cinnamon. Added 1/8 cup of sherry at the end. Quick any easy recipe.

I used vegetable broth instead of chicken and a hand emulsifier to slightly beat down the size of the mushrooms. This flavor is phenomenal. I tasted before and after adding the cinnamon. Go ahead and add the cinnamon. It gives the soup a slightly nutty taste. 
I will make this again - probably monthly. It was super simple!

I upped the portions to 12 and used one kind of mushrooms - crimini. Used regular onion instead of shallots. It was wonderful. Really hit the spot. I used less half-n-half than the 12 portion ingredient list called for. Yes, I would make it again.

I used chopped onions because that's all I had, I also blended it because my teen doesn't like mushrooms and he is easily fooled if you can't see the vegetable...It was quite good and a breeze to make.

Outstanding soup that Hs become. Thanksgiving tradition for my family! I blend shitake, portabella, and white mushrooms, which gives a nice depth of flavor and I use an immersion blender to keep a little texture.
I added fresh garlic in the sautee portion of it and I also used some paprika. I used more mushrooms as well. It definitely needed the extra seasoning and flavors.
Easy, quick and good.

This soup is quick and easy to make and very delicious. Typically, I love really thick roux based cream soups, but this one has a great flavorful blend of mushrooms that just sets it apart. I doubled the recipe but didn't have enough chicken broth, so I used half beef/half chicken and it was so good. I really think either broth would go well or a combo like I did out of necessity.
although this soup was good, something was missing. i did forget to add the pinch of cinnamon but not sure if that was the missing ingredient.
Super easy to make, and the family loved it! I added fresh thyme to mine, and it added a little extra to it.
Very good! Quick too. Love the cinnamon flavor too.
This was so delicious. Not a DROP left!

It is always a joy to find a basic recipe for something. This is a keeper and will be the start of all my mushroom soups. I used everything and tried a bit of cinnamon in one bowl. It was ok but not to my particular taste. I can see adding other veggies and am thinking about fried tofu croutons. Thank you for posting this recipe.
I made it exactly as the recipe listed except I added chopped kale. It was amazing. Very rich and complex. I did add the cinnamon as well.
So good! And easy. I used all portobellos and onions instead of shallots because I didn't want to go to the store.
Yummy good!

I followed the steps accordingly except for a few. I doubled the amount of the mushrooms. I used shiitake mushrooms. Added garlic to bring out the flavour. Substituted half and half with cooking cream. The soup turned out to be so creamy and full of flavour. I’d have cut down the amount of shallots though. It tasted a wee bit too strong.
It was great and easy to make. I added a little bit of parsley to it. Next time, I'll use a bit more flour to thicken it up a bit more. I double the recipe for four servings.
It was a hit! Very tasty and it filled us up. Loved it!

Made a few adjustments. Mainly didn’t have many of the ingredients so I subbed half a red onion, half a yellow onion, and one large garlic for the shallots. I read a review that said to use beef stock, but didn’t have any on hand so I used one cup of chicken that I’d made the night before and one cup of water with a beef bouillon cube. Added parsley to the mix and used full fat milk with a little extra butter. No cinnamon but plenty of pepper for a nice kick. Delicious!

I loved this. I used hen of the woods mushrooms from my local farmers market, added a large cloves of garlic, and substituted canned goat’s milk for the half and half because I’m lactose intolerant. It turned out beautifully and tasted wonderful!

Loved it. Needed a hot dinner quick for a hungry husband who likes mushroom soup. We're adventurous diners, but the cinnamon felt like a risk. Both of us loved it, even the cinnamon! Hubs said "It's a keeper." Decided not to puree the mushrooms per usual and liked the change.
Will be my main Mushroom Soup recipe from now on... so fast and delicious. Served it with split bolios, buttered and topped with cheese. 2 minutes in the toaster oven at 400!

Umm, the whole dinner - comfort food taken up a notch and on the table in less than 30 minutes. Thank you, Lori, for the recipe!

Very good! I made this yesterday, knowing it would be even better today! I scaled this down to 4 servings and used a 10 oz pkg of white mushrooms. I did not have half &half on hand so I used 2% milk. That could be why it was on the thin side, not creamy. Maybe a little cornstarch would have helped that. (Heavy cream would work here, I'll bet.) I also did not have shallots available, so I sauteed 1/4 chopped onion along with the white mushrooms. I used beef broth instead of chicken and also added a little white wine, thyme and did do the cinnamon. Delicious soup and comes together very quickly!
Easy to make and delicious.
This was great and easy. I used portabella and plain white mushrooms rather than shiitake. It had great flavor and texture. Absolutely loved it. It really did take only 15 minutes or so to make.

I can't pass up 1/2 price mushrooms at our awesome Italian market. We toss them into spaghetti sauce, fajitas, chicken dishes and we always have a bowl of mushrooms & onions for gravys or omelettes but it hadn't occurred to me that a creamy mushroom soup was an easy fix. This was so easy, fast and, after 1 try is already on my go-to lunch list.
I omitted the optional cinnamon and used mushroom broth instead of chicken. I had planned on running it through the blender before serving but hubby loved the mix of rough chopped mushrooms. 

I should note that I'm a lazy cook who needs a huge payoff for very little effort (luckily, hubby is an amazing cook) and this recipe checked all my boxes.
This was so tasty. I will make it again!
easy
very light, easy to cook, love it!!!...
This soup is amazing and easy to make. So delicious as is I did not change anything except did not add nutmeg.

This is a great recipe. Flavorful and easy to make -- economical. I doubled the recipe and was a little creative: more mushrooms, more flour for a more creamy consistence and I did use the cinnamon because my sis is partial to that spice and she was able to pick up its subtle flavor. 

I did not blend any of the mushrooms and she suggested next go round to do so. I'll blend the portobello but not the others.

Will definitely make this over and over.

This was really good. Make it with portabella and white cap because shiitake mushrooms were expensive. I did what others did and added rosemary and put a few mushrooms in food processors to for more texture. I doubled batch and 3 people at all of it no leftovers.
I'm going to make this for eight people next week. Seems easy enough and satisfying
Delicious, it is grand!
Tremendous flavor! Made a few changes, used all baby bella mushrooms and added garlic. Also used beef stock, and even lamb stock once, and light cream and it was fabulous!
Great soup. Followed exactly but had to add a touch of thyme. Family really enjoyed. A do-over?---yes, yes, yes.

I followed the recipe to a T, but all I had on hand at the time was white mushrooms ( we're pretty rural). The soup turned out great anyway! Not a huge shitake fan, but I would use crimini or portabello next time for a stonger mushroomy flavor. I also used an immersion blender and overdid it, I would keep more just chopped next time. Great recipe!

Delicious. Would definitely try this again. It almost tasted like canned mushroom soup that you buy, but chunkier because of all the chopped mushrooms. I did have to use white mushrooms instead of the shiitake and also added a little bit of garlic powder as suggested by another poster.

I made a gluten free, lower fat version by subbing brown rice flour and opting for fat free evaporated milk. I also added two cloves of garlic and it turned out so rich and full of mushroom flavor! I might experiment with the leftovers and try blending a portion and mixing it back in to give a bit more body. Very easy, straightforward and delicious soup, thanks for sharing!

This soup is very good. I prepared it as is and tasted great. Don't hesitate to add the cinnamon it will be fine. After tasting it, I decided to add a pinch of dried thyme and it just enhanced the earthy/nutty the flavor of the soup so much. I will definitely make it again. As someone else suggested, have this soup with crusty bread. Delicious!

Super simple soup for a winter evening. It needed a little something to bring it up a notch. After adding a little slug of sherry and some thyme I was much happier. Also processed some in Vitamix to smooth it out. I'll make it again for sure.
I doubled the recipe and used shallots & leeks. I also wanted it a little hardier, so I added a potatoe. It turned out great! Very tasty!

Outstanding!!! I made it exactly as written, except I added nutmeg instead of cinnamon. It was flavor filled, creamy and the texture of the mushrooms and shallots perfect. I made it earlier in the day, let it cool down and let the flavors pull through andI will be making this often.
This was so rich and delicious. Definitely a crowd pleaser! Made a double batch.
Yum yum!! We used veggie broth to make this vegetarian. Added garlic as others suggested and parm when served. Even our 6 month old baby loved it!!
This is great! The touch of cinnamon adds just the right touch. I will make this often.
This is so delicious. Better than any other mushroom soup I have ever eaten! I like my soups chunky so doubled the mushrooms. Also used old style table cream. I am going to make this a lot!!

Really pleased with the simplicity of this soup, and amazed by the great flavor. I did use a sprinkle of cinnamon and it's good. Also took the suggestion to add a tad of garlic. Used the immersion blender to make creamier with some chunks left. Yum! I will keep and share this fantastic recipe! Thank You!!
Delicious!

Didn't have half & half so I used whole milk. Followed the rest of the recipe, to the letter. Still pleasantly surprised - especially since I've never had mushroom soup before! This was definitely the best way to use up the last of the fresh mushrooms in my fridge. Definitely a hearty soup for super cheap. Yay!

I truly enjoyed this! I stuck to the recipe the best I could. I didn't have shallots, so I just used a sweet yellow onion. No Shiitake mushrooms, just 8 oz of baby bellas, so that is what I used. I saw in some of the comments some pureed it but, I didn't and I'm glad. I like the texture differences that it had. I was a little skeptical of the cinnamon but, I always like to stick to the recipe the first time, so in my first bowl I put a dash. I liked the smell and comfort it gave but then on the 2nd bowl, I just ate plain and liked the true mushroom flavor coming through. So, try it either way. Make sure you do cook a couple of minutes after adding the flour just to cook off the flour taste, I always do. Even though I thought it was great, I think next time, I might just add a tad of Sherry or White wine, just to try with that extra layer of flavor.
I had field(like button but better) and shaggy parasol mushrooms, and I used carnation milk instead of the cream. Wow is this a great recipe! I will be making it again!
It rained all day. Came home tired and wet. All I wanted was soup. This took 15 from start to finish. Soup Perfection. Thank you!
Made it just like it says. Mmmm, delicious! ! ! ! !
loved it. I used dried mushooms I rehydrated I did substitute the nutmeg for the cinnamon. I kept everything else the same. My whole family enjoyed this soup.

Great!!! Love it
Easy and super tasty 
Plus i added some cheese )
Added a bit of pancetta to the sauté, made a nice addition.
Really good! I added green onion and boiled egg as well.
Added broccoli. The soup did not come out as thick as I would have liked but, still very tasty. Thank you!
Good and hearty. I used baby bellas and button. No cinamon.
